com.ui.table
Class ColumnDefinition

java.lang.Object
  com.ui.table.ColumnDefinition

public class ColumnDefinition
extends java.lang.Object

Java bean class that manages the JTable-to-Model mapping definition details of a specified column.

Author:
rterrell

Constructor Detail

ColumnDefinition

public ColumnDefinition()
Creates a ColumnDefinition without any column definitions.

Defaults all columns to be resizable. This will allow the user to employ a pointing device such as a mouse to adjust the width of a column by dragging the borders of the column header inward and outward.

ColumnDefinition

public ColumnDefinition(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String displayValue,
                        int index)
Creates a ColumnDefinition identified by the column's assoicated bean property name, its header display value, and its position in JTable column list.

Parameters:
propertyName - The property name belonging to the model (java bean) that will map to the JTable column.
displayValue - The description of the column that will be displayed as column header
index - The column postion where the column will be placed in the JTable.

ColumnDefinition

public ColumnDefinition(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String displayValue,
                        int index,
                        int width)
Creates a ColumnDefinition identified by the column's assoicated bean property name, its header display value, its position in JTable column list, and its width. param propertyName The property name belonging to the model (java bean) that will map to the JTable column.

Parameters:
displayValue - The description of the column that will be displayed as column header
index - The column postion where the column will be placed in the JTable.
width - The width of the column. This will also set the prefered width property to this value.
